item.title: 迪士尼任命内部人士迈克尔-莫里亚蒂为迪士尼体验部财务总监
item.description: 迪士尼周二任命内部人士迈克尔-莫里亚蒂（Michael Moriarty）为财务总监兼迪士尼体验部执行副总裁，接替凯文-兰斯贝里（Kevin Lansberry）。【原文：Disney on Tuesday named insider Michael Moriarty as the finance chief and executive vice president of Disney Experiences, succeeding Kevin Lansberry.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构取消西太平洋银行 3.24 亿澳元的资本附加条款
item.description: 澳大利亚审慎监管机构周三表示，在西太平洋银行完成了所需的多年风险转型计划后，该机构已取消了对该行额外增加的 5 亿澳元（3.2415 亿美元）资本。【原文：Australia's prudential regulator said on Wednesday that it has removed the additional A$500 million ($324.15 million) capital add-on on Westpac after the bank completed a required multi-year risk transformation program.】

item.title: Stellantis 将在美国投资 130 亿美元
item.description: Stellantis 于本周二宣布在美国投资 130 亿美元，此举将为市场带来五款新车型，并在未来四年内为美国中西部的工厂增加 5000 个工作岗位。【原文：Stellantis announced a $13 billion investment in the U.S. on Tuesday, a move it said will bring five new models to the market and add 5,000 jobs in plants across the Midwest over the next four years.】

item.title: 中美紧张局势加剧，比特币和以太币下跌，抹去周一涨幅
item.description: 由于中美紧张局势加剧，比特币和以太币周二暴跌，抹去了前一天受唐纳德-特朗普总统和解贸易言论推动的涨势。【原文：Bitcoin and ether tumbled on Tuesday as U.S.-China tension ramped up, wiping out a rally the day before that was fueled by President Donald Trump's conciliatory trade remarks.】

item.title: 交易日：鲍威尔讲话、银行业绩带来宽慰
item.description: 了解推动全球市场的各种力量【原文：Making sense of the forces driving global markets】

item.title: 道富投资管理公司称，流入美国 ETF 的资金突破 1 万亿美元，速度创历史新高
item.description: 道富投资管理公司（State Street Investment Management）周二表示，投资者正快速将资金投入美国的交易所交易基金，使今年迄今为止的资金流入量突破了 1 万亿美元大关。【原文：Investors are directing money into U.S.-based exchange-traded funds at a rapid clip, pushing inflows so far this year across the $1 trillion line, State Street Investment Management said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 耐克以联合创始人菲利普-奈特的名字重新命名俄勒冈总部
item.description: 耐克公司周二表示，将以联合创始人菲利普-奈特的名字重新命名其位于俄勒冈州比弗顿的全球总部，并立即生效。【原文：Nike said on Tuesday it was renaming its world headquarters in Beaverton, Oregon, after co-founder Philip Knight with immediate effect.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Apollo Global 再次提出收购 Papa John's 的要约
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿波罗全球管理公司在上周提交了一份新的出价，希望以每股 64 美元的价格将比萨连锁店 Papa John's International 私有化。【原文：Apollo Global Management submitted a fresh bid within the last week to take pizza chain Papa John’s International private at $64 per share, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普考虑终止与中国的部分贸易关系，包括与食用油有关的贸易关系
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二表示，华盛顿正在考虑终止与中国的一些贸易关系，包括与食用油有关的贸易关系。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday Washington was considering terminating some trade ties with China, including in relation to cooking oil.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯仍赞成进一步降息以帮助就业市场
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周二重申，在经济环境仍不确定的情况下，就业市场风险上升支持央行进一步降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins reiterated Tuesday that rising risks to the job market support additional central bank interest rate cuts in what remains an uncertain economic environment.】

item.title: 美国参议院委员会定于下周就航空安全立法进行表决
item.description: 美国参议院商务委员会将于 10 月 21 日就航空安全立法进行投票表决。今年 1 月，美国航空公司一架支线飞机和一架陆军直升机在里根华盛顿国家机场附近相撞，造成 67 人死亡。【原文：The U.S. Senate Commerce Committee is set to vote on October 21 on aviation safety legislation after a fatal January crash between an American Airlines regional jet and an Army helicopter near Reagan Washington National Airport killed 67 people.】

item.title: 贸易组织希望禁止向中国出口废铝罐
item.description: 一个代表铝行业的贸易团体周二呼吁禁止美国向中国出口废旧饮料罐，以支持美国的汽车、战斗机、坦克和卫星生产。【原文：A trade group representing the aluminum industry called on Tuesday for a ban on U.S. exports of used beverage cans to China to support American production of cars, fighter jets, tanks and satellites.】

item.title: OpenAI 将从 12 月起允许成人认证用户在 ChatGPT 上使用成熟内容
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）表示，自 12 月起，将允许在平台上验证年龄的 ChatGPT 用户使用成熟内容。【原文：OpenAI will allow mature content for ChatGPT users who verify their age on the platform starting in December, CEO Sam Altman said, after the chatbot was made restrictive for users in mental distress.】

item.title: 中美贸易担忧加剧，华尔街恐慌指数攀升
item.description: 华尔街最受关注的投资者焦虑指数周二升至近五个月高点，随后收窄涨幅，原因是美股因中美贸易冲突的担忧重燃而大幅震荡。【原文：Wall Street's most watched gauge of investor anxiety rose to a near five-month high before paring gains on Tuesday as U.S. stocks whipsawed on renewed concerns over a U.S.-China trade conflict.】

item.title: 美国银行对监管机构放宽资本要求的举措欢呼雀跃
item.description: 美国银行高管们对特朗普政府监管机构将放宽资本规定表示乐观，这与拜登政府时期更严格的建议相比是一个重大逆转。【原文：U.S. bank executives expressed optimism that Trump administration regulators will soften capital rules, a major reversal from stricter proposals under the Biden administration.】

item.title: 报告称美国政府停摆威胁洪水易发地区房屋销售
item.description: 周二的数据显示，美国政府停摆可能会阻碍洪水多发地区的潜在房主获得保险保障，并使本已陷入困境的房地产市场因合同成交延迟而损失数十亿美元。【原文：A shutdown of the U.S. government could hinder the accessibility of insurance coverage to prospective homeowners in flood-prone areas, and cost the already struggling housing market billions of dollars in delayed contract closings, data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: Spotify 视频播客与 Netflix 建立新的发行合作关系
item.description: Netflix 周二表示，它将从 2026 年初开始在其服务中加入 Spotify 最受欢迎的视频播客，这是新的发行合作伙伴关系的一部分，旨在扩大这家流媒体巨头的娱乐阵容并吸引新的受众。【原文：Netflix said on Tuesday it will add a slate of Spotify's most popular video podcasts to its service from early 2026, part of a new distribution partnership aimed at broadening the streaming giant's entertainment lineup and drawing new audiences.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）支持的 Solmate 公司在上周的缩编中收购了 Solana 公司
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的方舟投资公司（Ark Invest）支持的Solmate Infrastructure周二表示，在上周数字资产市场大幅回调期间，该公司已经买入了加密货币solana。【原文：Cathie Wood's Ark Invest-backed Solmate Infrastructure said on Tuesday that it had picked up cryptocurrency solana during last week's sharp pullback in the market for digital assets.】

item.title: 英特尔客户将于明年下半年测试新的新月岛 GPU
item.description: 英特尔正通过即将推出的数据中心图形处理单元（代号为 "新月岛"），在快速增长的人工智能芯片竞赛中再下一城。【原文：Intel is making a renewed push to secure a spot in the fast-growing AI chip race with its upcoming data center graphics processing unit, code-named Crescent Island, slated for customer sampling in the second half of 2026.】

item.title: First Brands 和 Tricolor 倒闭招致更多审查，但华尔街认为信贷质量稳健
item.description: 美国汽车零部件供应商 First Brands 和汽车经销商 Tricolor 的破产引发了华尔街的反思，摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）表示，尽管银行普遍认为美国借款人的信用质量很高，但在发现自己暴露于风险之后，摩根大通重新审查了自己的控制措施。【原文：The bankruptcies of U.S. auto parts supplier First Brands and car dealership Tricolor have prompted soul searching on Wall Street, with JPMorgan Chase saying it re-examined its controls after finding itself exposed, although banks broadly said that U.S. borrowers' credit quality is robust.】

item.title: Facebook 关闭了司法部称被用于骚扰 ICE 探员的页面
item.description: 美国司法部周二表示，Meta 公司已经按照要求撤下了其 Facebook 平台上的一个页面，该机构称该页面被用来骚扰芝加哥的 ICE 探员。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday that Meta had complied with its request to take down a page on its Facebook platform that the agency said was being used to harass ICE agents in Chicago.】

item.title: 欧盟反垄断罚款迫在眉睫，谷歌主动调整搜索结果
item.description: 据路透社看到的一份文件显示，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌已提出对其搜索结果进行进一步修改，以避免被欧盟处以反垄断罚款。【原文：Alphabet's Google has offered to make further changes to its search results in its latest attempt to avoid a European Union antitrust fine, according to a document seen by Reuters.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储鲍威尔称经济基础更加稳固，QT 结束在望
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，尽管美国经济整体 "可能比预期更稳健"，但美国劳动力市场在9月份仍深陷低招聘、低雇用的低迷状态。【原文：The U.S. labor market remained mired in its low-hiring, low-firing doldrums through September, though the economy overall "may be on a somewhat firmer trajectory than expected," Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长维勒鲁瓦表示，世界金融稳定需要美国的参与
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）周二表示，保护主义已经证明会让美国消费者付出高昂的代价，华盛顿应该与其盟友合作，共同解决威胁金融稳定的全球问题。【原文：Protectionism is already proving costly for the U.S. consumer and Washington should instead engage with its allies to tackle global issues that threaten financial stability, French central bank governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 加密货币投资者 "比特币耶稣 "就解决美国税务指控达成协议
item.description: 美国司法部周二表示，一名被称为 "比特币耶稣 "的比特币早期投资者已同意支付高达 4990 万美元，以解决美国对他逃避缴纳数千万美元税款的指控。【原文：An early investor in bitcoins dubbed the "Bitcoin Jesus" has agreed to pay up to $49.9 million to resolve U.S. charges that he evaded paying tens of millions of dollars in taxes, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Humana 输掉了对 2025 年医疗保险优势评级的挑战
item.description: 周二，美国一名法官驳回了 Humana 质疑美国医疗保险与医疗补助服务中心对其医疗保险优势项目 2025 年评级的请求，这可能使该公司从政府那里获得数百万美元的奖金。【原文：A U.S. judge on Tuesday rejected Humana's bid to challenge the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' 2025 ratings for its Medicare Advantage programs, which could cost the company millions in bonus payments from the government.】

item.title: 中国市场改善，LVMH 销售额恢复增长
item.description: 本周二，法国路威酩轩集团（LVMH）公布第三季度销售额增长 1%，主要得益于中国市场需求的增长，而奢侈品行业正面临着长期的低迷。【原文：France's LVMH reported a 1% rise in third quarter sales on Tuesday, helped by improved demand in China, as the luxury goods industry grapples with a prolonged slump.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称资产负债表缩减可能接近尾声
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，央行长期以来缩减持仓规模的努力（即广为人知的量化紧缩政策）可能即将结束。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday the end of the central bank’s long-running effort to shrink the size of its holdings, widely known as quantitative tightening, or QT, may be coming into view.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称经济基础更加稳固，但低招聘、低解雇趋势仍在继续
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，尽管经济整体 "可能比预期更稳健"，但美国劳动力市场在9月份仍处于低招聘、低雇用的低迷状态，同时他还指出，在平衡就业市场疲软与通胀率仍远高于2%目标之间的关系时，决策者将采取 "逐次会议 "的方式来决定是否进一步降息。【原文：The U.S. labor market remained mired in its low-hiring, low-firing doldrums through September, though the economy overall "may be on a somewhat firmer trajectory than expected," Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday, noting that policymakers will take a "meeting-by-meeting" approach to any further interest rate cuts as they balance job market weakness with the fact that inflation remains well above their 2% target.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表格里尔告诉CNBC，美国将于11月1日对中国征收关税，这取决于中国政府的行动
item.description: 美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）周二表示，对中国输美产品征收100%的额外关税是否在11月1日或更早生效取决于中国，但他承认中国政府可能很难找到脱身之计。【原文：U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer on Tuesday said it depended on China whether additional 100% tariffs on its exports to the United States kick in on November 1 or sooner, but acknowledged it might be hard for Beijing to find an off-ramp.】
